comparisonData.hollowKnight: The Knight: A silent, stoic vessel.
comparisonData.silksong: Hornet: A voiced, faster, and more acrobatic princess-protector.

comparisonData.hollowKnight: The decaying, underground Kingdom of Hallownest.
comparisonData.silksong: The vast, haunted Kingdom of Pharloom, ruled by Silk and Song.

comparisonData.hollowKnight: Standard dash and vertical 'pogo' bounce off enemies.
comparisonData.silksong: Faster base speed, a diagonal downward dash (no pogo), and the ability to mantle ledges.

comparisonData.hollowKnight: Uses SOUL to slowly 'Focus' and heal one mask at a time.
comparisonData.silksong: Uses a Silk meter. When full, Hornet can instantly heal three masks.

comparisonData.hollowKnight: Charm System: Equip found charms to gain passive abilities and buffs.
comparisonData.silksong: Tool Crafting System: Craft and equip a variety of tools like bombs, traps, and spiked balls for active use.

comparisonData.hollowKnight: Centered around a single primary hub town, Dirtmouth.
comparisonData.silksong: Features multiple towns and settlements, creating a more populated world.

source.label: Times of India - What to Expect

comparisonData.hollowKnight: Organic and unmarked, relying on player memory.
comparisonData.silksong: A formal, trackable quest log with categories (Gather, Wayfarer, Hunt).

comparisonData.hollowKnight: Over 30 bosses in the base game.
Over 140 enemies in the base game.
Hand-drawn 2D animation with a darker, more muted palette.
comparisonData.silksong: Enhanced hand-drawn animation with a more vibrant and diverse color palette.
Christopher Larkin returns to compose the score.

comparisonData.hollowKnight: Received multiple free major content packs (Gods & Glory, etc.).
comparisonData.silksong: Team Cherry has ambitious plans for content after launch.
